qas.question: Who was Charlemagne's only living son in 813?
How long did Louis the Pious reign?
When did the reign of Louis the Pious end?
Who ruled Italy after Louis the Pious?
Who was the middle son of Louis the Pious?

context: Charlemagne planned to continue the Frankish tradition of dividing his kingdom between all his heirs, but was unable to do so as only one son, <a0_0>Louis the Pious<a0_0/> (r. 814–<a2_0>840<a2_0/>), was still alive by 813. Just before Charlemagne died in 814, he crowned Louis as his successor. Louis's reign of <a1_0>26 years<a1_0/> was marked by numerous divisions of the empire among his sons and, after 829, civil wars between various alliances of father and sons over the control of various parts of the empire. Eventually, Louis recognised his eldest son <a3_0>Lothair I<a3_0/> (d. 855) as emperor and gave him Italy. Louis divided the rest of the empire between Lothair and Charles the Bald (d. 877), his youngest son. Lothair took East Francia, comprising both banks of the Rhine and eastwards, leaving Charles West Francia with the empire to the west of the Rhineland and the Alps. <a4_0>Louis the German<a4_0/> (d. 876), the middle child, who had been rebellious to the last, was allowed to keep Bavaria under the suzerainty of his elder brother. The division was disputed. Pepin II of Aquitaine (d. after 864), the emperor's grandson, rebelled in a contest for Aquitaine, while Louis the German tried to annex all of East Francia. Louis the Pious died in 840, with the empire still in chaos.
